availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas G. Cobb (Hopkins/ Webster County, Ky, farmer )

body.p: Hopkins County and Webster County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Jane Cobb. Father of James H. Cobb, Lee Ann Cobb, William H. Cobb, John Thomas Cobb, Sidney A. Cobb, William P. Cobb, Martha J. Cobb, and Julia A. Cobb. Farmer in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Employed Madison Cornel as a laborer in Hopkins County in 1850. Farmer in Webster County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 2, p. 141B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, p. 611.
"Thomas Greenberry Cobb (1820-1905)," Find A Grave, Memorial #72820114, accessed December 1, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/72820114.
